direct_answer.text:
To solve this equation directly, let us first clear denominators by multiplying through by \(585\) (the least common multiple of \(5\cdot9\cdot13\)):

\[117( (x+1)(x-3) ) + 65( (x+3)(x-5) ) - 102( (x+5)(x-7) ) = 92,\]

which simplifies somewhat because we eliminate fractions:

\[117(x^2 - 2x - 3) + 65(x^2 - 2x - 15) - 102(x^2 - 2x - 35) = 92,\]

Expanding out the quadratic terms:

\[117x^2 - 234x - 351 + 65x^2 - 130x - 975 - 102x^2 + 204x + 3570 = 92,\]

Combine like terms:

\[80x^2 - 26x - 97 = 92,\]

or

\[80x^2
